title: 5 takeaways from the Revolution’s season-opening defeat in Nashville
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution lost 4-1 to Nashville SC in the 2026 season opener at Geodis Park.
Three of four projected New England defensive starters were absent, contributing to a weak defensive performance.
Coach Marko MitroviÄ‡'s debut was marred by lineup decisions and defensive issues, hinting at a challenging season ahead.

title: New Commuter Rail fare gates at South Station break down again
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: South Station's Commuter Rail fare gates closed twice due to winter weather since opening late last year.
Wind and snow cause continued closure of some gates, with MBTA seeking alternatives for protection.
Despite issues, fare gates reportedly increased mTicket activations by 42% compared to last year.

title: Watch: Jack Hughes delivers USA first Olympic gold medal in men’s hockey since 1980, team honors Johnny Gaudreau
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jack Hughes scored the game-winning goal in overtime as USA defeated Canada 2-1 for the Olympic gold in men's hockey.
Team USA honored the late Johnny Gaudreau during the celebration by involving his children in the team picture with the medals.
Bruins players Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman won gold medals, marking the first time NHL players joined USA's gold-winning team.

title: After homering in spring training debut, could Andruw Monasterio play big role for Red Sox in 2026?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Andruw Monasterio hit a solo home run in the Red Sox' Grapefruit League opener against the Twins.
Monasterio is being considered for a key role in 2026 due to Romy Gonzalez's shoulder injury.
Manager Alex Cora cited Monasterio's athleticism and versatility as valuable assets for the Red Sox.

title: MSP arrests Maine man after he allegedly crashed truck twice while on drugs
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Andrew Beaulieu, 30, arrested in Massachusetts after allegedly crashing his truck twice while on drugs.
Beaulieu is charged with drug possession, operating under the influence, and negligent vehicle operation.
Police found synthetic cannabinoids in Beaulieu's truck; he pleaded not guilty in Fall River District Court.

title: Methuen woman searching for her wedding dress after dry cleaner mix-up
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Kathleen Shea Dunleavy of Methuen is searching for her wedding dress after a dry cleaner mix-up 15 years ago.
Dunleavy discovered the mistake when she opened a preservation box to find someone else's gown from Salem, NH.
She is using social media to locate her dress, which has unique features including the initials 'KS' embroidered in blue.

title: At Chevalier Theatre, Mavis Staples lives up to her legacy of joy and protest
author: Terence Cawley
bullets: Mavis Staples performed at Medford's Chevalier Theatre, blending her gospel-soul roots with modern Americana influences.
At 86, Staples balanced energetic performances with rest, supported by her band and backup singers for a 12-song set.
Staples addressed social issues during her concert, combining joyful music with protest songs like 'Freedom Highway' and 'No Time for Crying.'

title: Here’s how the Red Sox plan on handling MLB’s new ABS challenging system
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: The new MLB ABS challenge system allows players to contest balls and strikes starting in 2026.
Red Sox's Wilson Contreras was the first to use and win a challenge in a spring training game.
Teams have two challenges per game, retaining them if successful; managers can't initiate challenges.

title: Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet weighs in on Lucas Giolito’s ongoing free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Lucas Giolito remains unsigned in free agency after opting out of his Red Sox deal following a strong 2025 season.
Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet expressed disbelief at Giolito's free agent status, citing his strong performance in 2025.
Boston's rotation added Sonny Gray and Ranger Suarez after Giolito's departure, strengthening their MLB starting lineup.

title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots may target Colts WR Michael Pittman Jr. due to his $29 million cap hit and potential role replacement.
Bears WR DJ Moore is a trade candidate with a $24.5 million cap hit despite a down year and limited cap space.
Seahawks EDGE Uchenna Nwosu, with a $11.5 million cap hit, could be targeted if Patriots lose K'Lavon Chaisson.
